pullRequest.body:
Order/SuccPred/Basic.lean: add `SuccOrder.ofLinearWellFoundedLT`, which puts a SuccOrder on an arbitrary well-ordered type. Also add the dual, `PredOrder` version. Add missing `pred` lemmas corresponding to existing `succ` lemmas.

Order/SuccPred/Limit.lean: add `SuccOrder.limitRecOn` generalizing `Ordinal.limitRecOn` to allow definition by transfinite recursion on an arbitrary well-ordered type. (It turns out a **partial** well-founded order is enough.)

SetTheory/Ordinal/Arithmetic.lean: refactor `Ordinal.limitRecOn` to use `SuccOrder.limitRecOn`.

SetTheory/Cardinal/Ordinal.lean: add a lemma saying that the initial ordinal of an infinite cardinal is a NoMaxOrder.

SetTheory/Ordinal/Basic.lean: add `mk_Iio_ord_out_Î±`, a restatement of `card_typein_out_lt`.

---

Thanks for the review and delegation!

As this PR is labelled `auto-merge-after-CI`, we are now sending it to bors:

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9178260863/job/25237741549)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9178260863/job/25237742209)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9178260863/job/25237742598)

There is an asymmetry between the definitions
```
Ordinal.IsLimit o = (o â  0 â§ â a < o, Order.succ a < o)
Cardinal.IsLimit c = (c â  0 â§ Order.IsSuccLimit c)
```
but it's probably out of scope of this PR to align them.

Personally I find this indentation confusing. If the statement doesn't fit on a line, then I would argue you shouldn't start it  on the line of the `:`.
```suggestion
theorem _root_.SuccOrder.limitRecOn_limit (ha : IsSuccLimit a) :
    SuccOrder.limitRecOn a H_succ H_lim =
      H_lim a ha fun x _ â¦ SuccOrder.limitRecOn x H_succ H_lim := by
```
But also here you can just take advantage of the open namespaces.
```suggestion
theorem _root_.SuccOrder.limitRecOn_limit (ha : IsSuccLimit a) :
    limitRecOn a H_succ H_lim = H_lim a ha fun x _ â¦ limitRecOn x H_succ H_lim := by
```
Forgot to say: omitting the namespace doesn't actually work, which may have to do with the `_root_`.
Oh yeah that's a known bug
